lines.text: Mother Goose is requesting a chaplain.
A chaplain? Good heavens, he's killed her.
No, sir. They want to get married.
Married? Goody Two-Shoes and the Filthy Beast?
Do you have a boat?
No. I walked.

[Eckland has sucked the "poison" from Catherine's "snakebite"]
Tell me, I would like to know - what did my blood taste like?
Delicious. Now come on.
[he tries to take her coconut full of whiskey]
No, no, no, I'm serious. What did it taste like?
Well how would I know? I'm not a vampire,
Um, was it salty?
Mmm, a little salty, yes.
Too salty?
No, it was just right.
Oh, no! You thought it was too salty, I can tell! You didn't like it!
[she seems on the verge of crying]
I liked it!
Oh, really?
Uh-huh, I liked it!
You're not just saying that?
Great blood!
[catching a fish barehanded. A fish swims toward them]

[In a hushed voice]
Hey, here she comes again.
How do you know it's a "she"?
Her mouth is open, now be quiet.

[about the Coast Watching Service]
We've been friends for a long time. Do you really think you can talk me into it?
No, I suppose you're right. Stebbings, confiscate all the small craft on this pier.
But this is the only one there is, Sir.
Confiscate it.
Yes, sir.
Frank, you can't do that! I'll go over your head! Who's in charge here?
He is!
Frank, you can't do that to me! That boat's all I have!
You said we've been friends for a long time, Walter. Do you really think you can talk me out of it?
Let me tell you I am not a father figure. I am not a brother figure or an uncle figure or a cousin figure. In fact, the only figure I intend being is a total stranger figure.
All those miles of open sea and back again a man would need something to keep warm, now, wouldn't he?
2 bottles.
All of them, Frank.
Three.
All of them, Frank.
Five.
All of them, Frank.
Got a pencil?

[after bring the girls back to the island, Mr. Eckland is sitting eating while all the girls watch him]
If you're waiting for the big finale, I'm sorry this is all I do.
You stepped on my foot.
You put it under mine.

[to the French girls]
You two get in the bottom of the boat.
[pause]
Get in the bottom of the boat!
They don't understand English.
Sure they do.
[puts them in the boat]
See?

[Jenny hands Walter a whiskey bottle]
Jenny!
Why, how strange!
What?
That you should bring me this.
I've done it before.
No you haven't.
Yes I have.
Shut up.
There's a bit of paperwork to fill out, Walter. Who's the Maid of Honor?
Umm, Elizabeth Anderson.
And the Best Man?
Uh, Harry MacGregor.
Harry?
Just believe me.

[Speaking of Walter]
I believe I've found our nail, Sir. A rusty one I grant you, but they don't come any sharper.

[Telling Walter the code-names to be used on the radio]
I'm Big Bad Wolf, Stebbings here is Bo Peep, and you're...
Mother Goose, Sir.
That's it. You're Mother Goose. Now try and remember all that, Walter. It's bloody important.
Yeah, bloody.

[after Catherine threw the rifle in the water]
No, no, no! Not that! We'd had a use for that!
How in English do you say "parachute"?
Uh... Parachute.
We could have transferred George Dickens from the interior if he hadn't gotten himself eaten that way.
You needn't make him sound such a shirker, Stebbings.
[Walter is about to go do something very dangerous]
Walter! I look awful in black.
[last lines]
I wonder if they serve coconut milk on submarines...
I'm a... a picture straightener.
You're a what?
A picture straightener.
Oh.
When I see a picture on a wall that doesn't hang straightly, I straighten it.
Oh, you do that.
And I brush my teeth every morning and every night.
And if I don't have a toothbrush...

[Demonstrating]
... I use my finger.
Where is your boat?

[Indicating the dinghy]
It's right there lady. If you spit you'd sink it.
Mr Eckland is a rude, foul-mouthed, drunken, filthy beast

[Jenny, who won't talk, has just given him a bottle of liquor. She doesn't reply when he says "Thank you." He holds up a whistle]
See this whistle?
[Jenny nods "yes"]
Would you like to have it?"
[She nods "yes" again]
OK. Now, all you have to do is repeat three simple words after me. Is that a deal?
[She nods "yes"]
Just repeat three words. Alright. Elephant.

[Looks from Eckland to the whistle and back. Seems to consider for a moment]
Elephant.

[He smiles, slightly]
Rhinoceros.

[More quickly this time]
Rhinoceros.
Wrong.
WHy?
No, not "why," "wrong." Wrong is the third word, you lose.
Look at their clothes.
They're my clothes.
But they're filthy.
No, they're dirty, I'm filthy.
So far you're shared me out of my clothes, my food and my house. Now, how about sharing some of my things with me.
Great blood!
Frank. Kiss my foot Frank.
I have an infuriating lack of talent for doing simple things.
You probably don't do them right, that's why.
Lady, you are making a powerful enemy.
I say, where are you going with those?
Do you know who I am?
Well, no.
We'll let it go this time.
Mr. Eckland got Jenny to speak.
I created a monster. A talking person.
Bride's full name?
Catherine Louise Marie Ernestine Freneau.

[Gives Catherine a strange look]
Eh!
Groom's full name?
Walter Christopher Eckland.
Maybe if you stopped straightening pictures and let men wear their own pants, maybe they'd be able to touch you without asking "permesso!"
[Eckland has just discovered that there was no snake when Houghton, who believes Catherine is dead, is calling]
Walter? Are you there, Walter? I have the chaplain, I thought it might be a comfort if he said a few words.
Never mind the chaplain, Frank. She's alive. The snake's dead.
Walter, explain yourself.
[Eckland puts down the microphone]
Walter? Walter?
[shouting]
Walter!

[grabs one of the girls suitcases out of her hand and throws it in the water. Ms. Freneau begins to protest]
This isn't the Queen Mary; we don't have room for luggage.
Mr. Eckland please keep the boat quiet, the girls are extremely frightened.
Will you shut up, lady?
We're sinking!
Well don't just sit there, dammit, start bailing!
Mr. Eckland, your language!

[after explaining the Coast-watching service]
It's ary important work, Walter. Damned important. You'd might like to volunteer.
the "Watch Out for Walter Eckland" Service!
A great many lives are at stake, Mr. Eckland!

Now listen to me, both of you! Now, several years ago, I made peace with the World. Now, if the World isn't bright enough to make peace with ITSELF, it's just going to have to settle things without me!

[after Frank's ship bashes a hole in Walter's boat to get him to go to Matalava]
FRANK, HAVE YOU LOST YOUR MIND? LOOK AT MY BOAT!

[on a bullhorn, pleased with himself]
Terribly sorry, Walter! Our steering must have jammed! I'm sorry!
IF YOU DIDN'T KNOW HOW TO WORK ONE OF THOSE THINGS, WHY DIDN'T YOU SAY SO?
I am sorry!
OH, STOP SAYING THAT! LOOK AT MY BOAT! WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO NOW?
Become a Coast Watcher, I expect! Luckily, we put a little surprise ashore! Oh, Walter... we'll stand by until you get safely in!
FRANK, I'LL SUE YOU! I'LL SUE! I'LL SUE THE ENTIRE WAR!
Quite right, Walter! I'll be your witness!
[adding]
Oh, and Walter... Thanks for volunteering!

[on the radio on his island]
When do I get off?
I told you, as soon as we find a replacement for you. In the meantime, try to relax. Oh, and I'm very sorry about your boat. I really am.
Is Big Bad Wolf *really* sorry? Because if he is, Big Bad Wolf and Little Bo Peep can DO something for Mother Goose. THEY CAN GO...
[Stebbings cuts the radio off before any profanity goes through]

[to Stebbings]
I don't really blame him, do you?
Sir, I don't think we've accomplished anything. I don't think he'll report in. I mean, you can lead a horse to water, but can you make it drink?

[calmly]
When he gets thirsty, he'll drink, Stebbings. He'll drink.
